name: initialize
description:
Upon creating the MediaPlayer you must call initialize before you call anything else.
There is one exception to this rule. It is crucial to call {@link module:MediaPlayer#extend extend()}
with all your extensions prior to calling initialize.

ALL arguments are optional and there are individual methods to set each argument later on.
The args in this method are just for convenience and should only be used for a simple player setup.

paramExplanation.description: Optional arg to set the video element. {@link module:MediaPlayer#attachView attachView()}
paramExplanation.name: view

paramExplanation.description: Optional arg to set the media source. {@link module:MediaPlayer#attachSource attachSource()}
paramExplanation.name: source

paramExplanation.description: Optional arg to set auto play. {@link module:MediaPlayer#setAutoPlay setAutoPlay()}
paramExplanation.name: AutoPlay

name: off
description: Use the off method to remove listeners for public events found in MediaPlayer.events. {@link MediaPlayerEvents}

paramExplanation.description: {@link MediaPlayerEvents}
paramExplanation.name: type

paramExplanation.description: callback method when the event fires.
paramExplanation.name: listener

paramExplanation.description: context of the listener so it can be removed properly.
paramExplanation.name: scope

name: extend
description:
This method should be used to extend or replace internal dash.js objects. There are two ways to extend dash.js (determined by the override argument):
  1. If you set override to true any public method or property in your custom object will override the dash.js parent object's property(ies) and will be used instead but the dash.js parent module will still be created.
  2. If you set override to false your object will completely replace the dash.js object. (Note: This is how it was in 1.x of Dash.js with Dijon).
When you extend you get access to this.context, this.factory and this.parent to operate with in your custom object.
  • this.context - can be used to pass context for singleton access.
  • this.factory - can be used to call factory.getSingletonInstance().
  • this.parent - is the reference of the parent object to call other public methods. (this.parent is excluded if you extend with override set to false or option 2)
You must call extend before you call initialize

paramExplanation.description: name of parent module
paramExplanation.name: parentNameString

paramExplanation.description: overriding object
paramExplanation.name: childInstance

paramExplanation.description: replace only some methods (true) or the whole object (false)
paramExplanation.name: override

name: attachView
description: Use this method to attach an HTML5 VideoElement for dash.js to operate upon.

paramExplanation.description: An HTMLMediaElement that has already been defined in the DOM (or equivalent stub).
paramExplanation.name: element

name: attachSource
description:
Use this method to set a source URL to a valid MPD manifest file OR
a previously downloaded and parsed manifest object.  Optionally, can
also provide protection information

paramExplanation.description:
A URL to a valid MPD manifest file, or a
parsed manifest object.
paramExplanation.name: urlOrManifest

name: isReady
description: The ready state of the MediaPlayer based on both the video element and MPD source being defined.

returns.description: The current ready state of the MediaPlayer

name: play
description:
The play method initiates playback of the media defined by the {@link module:MediaPlayer#attachSource attachSource()} method.
This method will call play on the native Video Element.

name: isPaused
description: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the Video Element is paused.

name: pause
description: This method will call pause on the native Video Element.

name: isSeeking
description: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the media is in the process of seeking to a new position.

name: isDynamic
description: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the media is in the process of dynamic.

name: seek
description:
Sets the currentTime property of the attached video element.  If it is a live stream with a
timeShiftBufferLength, then the DVR window offset will be automatically calculated.

paramExplanation.description: A relative time, in seconds, based on the return value of the {@link module:MediaPlayer#duration duration()} method is expected
paramExplanation.name: value

name: setPlaybackRate
description: Use this method to set the native Video Element's playback rate.

name: getPlaybackRate
description: Returns the current playback rate.

name: setMute
description: Use this method to set the native Video Element's muted state. Takes a Boolean that determines whether audio is muted. true if the audio is muted and false otherwise.

name: isMuted
description: A Boolean that determines whether audio is muted.

name: setVolume
description: A double indicating the audio volume, from 0.0 (silent) to 1.0 (loudest).

name: getVolume
description: Returns the current audio volume, from 0.0 (silent) to 1.0 (loudest).

name: time
description:
Current time of the playhead, in seconds.

If called with no arguments then the returned time value is time elapsed since the start point of the first stream, or if it is a live stream, then the time will be based on the return value of the {@link module:MediaPlayer#duration duration()} method.
However if a stream ID is supplied then time is relative to the start of that stream, or is null if there is no such stream id in the manifest.

returns.description: The current playhead time of the media, or null.

paramExplanation.description: The ID of a stream that the returned playhead time must be relative to the start of. If undefined, then playhead time is relative to the first stream.
paramExplanation.name: streamId

name: duration
description: Duration of the media's playback, in seconds.

returns.description: The current duration of the media.

name: timeAsUTC
description:
Use this method to get the current playhead time as an absolute value, the time in seconds since midnight UTC, Jan 1 1970.
Note - this property only has meaning for live streams. If called before play() has begun, it will return a value of NaN.

returns.description: The current playhead time as UTC timestamp.

name: durationAsUTC
description:
Use this method to get the current duration as an absolute value, the time in seconds since midnight UTC, Jan 1 1970.
Note - this property only has meaning for live streams.

returns.description: The current duration as UTC timestamp.

name: getActiveStream
description: This method returns the active stream

name: getDVRWindowSize
description: The timeShiftBufferLength (DVR Window), in seconds.

returns.description: The window of allowable play time behind the live point of a live stream.

name: getDVRSeekOffset
description:
This method should only be used with a live stream that has a valid timeShiftBufferLength (DVR Window).
NOTE - If you do not need the raw offset value (i.e. media analytics, tracking, etc) consider using the {@link module:MediaPlayer#seek seek()} method
which will calculate this value for you and set the video element's currentTime property all in one simple call.

returns.description: A value that is relative the available range within the timeShiftBufferLength (DVR Window).

paramExplanation.description: A relative time, in seconds, based on the return value of the {@link module:MediaPlayer#duration duration()} method is expected.
paramExplanation.name: value

name: convertToTimeCode
description: A utility method which converts seconds into TimeCode (i.e. 300 --> 05:00).

returns.description: A formatted time code string.

paramExplanation.description: A number in seconds to be converted into a formatted time code.
paramExplanation.name: value

name: formatUTC
description: A utility methods which converts UTC timestamp value into a valid time and date string.

returns.description: A formatted time and date string.

paramExplanation.description: UTC timestamp to be converted into date and time.
paramExplanation.name: time

paramExplanation.description: a region identifier (i.e. en_US).
paramExplanation.name: locales

paramExplanation.description: 12 vs 24 hour. Set to true for 12 hour time formatting.
paramExplanation.name: hour12

paramExplanation.description: default is false. Set to true to append current date to UTC time format.
paramExplanation.name: withDate

name: getVersion
description: Current version of Dash.js

returns.description: the current dash.js version string.

name: getDebug
description: Use this method to access the dash.js logging class.

name: getBufferLength
description:
The length of the buffer for a given media type, in seconds. Valid media
types are "video", "audio" and "fragmentedText". If no type is passed
in, then the minimum of video, audio and fragmentedText buffer length is
returned. NaN is returned if an invalid type is requested, the
presentation does not contain that type, or if no arguments are passed
and the presentation does not include any adaption sets of valid media
type.

returns.description:
The length of the buffer for the given media type, in
 seconds, or NaN

paramExplanation.description: 'video', 'audio' or 'fragmentedText'
paramExplanation.name: type

name: getTTMLRenderingDiv
description: Returns instance of Div that was attached by calling attachTTMLRenderingDiv()

name: getVideoElement
description: Returns instance of Video Element that was attached by calling attachView()

name: getSource
description: Returns the source string or manifest that was attached by calling attachSource()

name: getTopBitrateInfoFor
description:
Gets the top quality BitrateInfo checking portal limit and max allowed.
It calls getTopQualityIndexFor internally

paramExplanation.description: 'video' or 'audio'
paramExplanation.name: type

name: setAutoPlay
description: Set to false to prevent stream from auto-playing when the view is attached.

returns.description: The current autoPlay state.

name: getDashMetrics
description:
Returns the DashMetrics.js Module. You use this Module to get access to all the public metrics
stored in dash.js

name: getDashAdapter
description: Returns the DashAdapter.js Module.

name: getQualityFor
description:
Gets the current download quality for media type video, audio or images. For video and audio types the ABR
rules update this value before every new download unless setAutoSwitchQualityFor(type, false) is called. For 'image'
type, thumbnails, there is no ABR algorithm and quality is set manually.

returns.description: the quality index, 0 corresponding to the lowest bitrate

paramExplanation.description: 'video', 'audio' or 'image' (thumbnails)
paramExplanation.name: type

name: setQualityFor
description:
Sets the current quality for media type instead of letting the ABR Heuristics automatically selecting it.
This value will be overwritten by the ABR rules unless setAutoSwitchQualityFor(type, false) is called.

paramExplanation.description: 'video', 'audio' or 'image'
paramExplanation.name: type

paramExplanation.description: the quality index, 0 corresponding to the lowest bitrate
paramExplanation.name: value

name: updatePortalSize
description:
Update the video element size variables
Should be called on window resize (or any other time player is resized). Fullscreen does trigger a window resize event.

Once windowResizeEventCalled = true, abrController.checkPortalSize() will use element size variables rather than querying clientWidth every time.

name: enableText
description:
Enable/disable text
When enabling text, dash will choose the previous selected text track

paramExplanation.description: true to enable text, false otherwise (same as setTextTrack(-1))
paramExplanation.name: enable

name: setTextTrack
description:
Use this method to change the current text track for both external time text files and fragmented text tracks. There is no need to
set the track mode on the video object to switch a track when using this method.

paramExplanation.description: Index of track based on the order of the order the tracks are added Use -1 to disable all tracks. (turn captions off).  Use module:MediaPlayer#dashjs.MediaPlayer.events.TEXT_TRACK_ADDED.
paramExplanation.name: idx

name: getTextDefaultLanguage
description: Get default language for text.

returns.description: the default language if it has been set using setTextDefaultLanguage

name: setTextDefaultLanguage
description: Set default language for text. If default language is not one of text tracks, dash will choose the first one.

paramExplanation.description: default language
paramExplanation.name: lang

name: getTextDefaultEnabled
description: Get enabled default state.

returns.description: default enable state

name: setTextDefaultEnabled
description:
Set enabled default state.
This is used to enable/disable text when a file is loaded.
During playback, use enableText to enable text for the file

paramExplanation.description: true to enable text, false otherwise
paramExplanation.name: enable

name: provideThumbnail
description: Provide the thumbnail at time position. This can be asynchronous, so you must provide a callback ro retrieve thumbnails informations

paramExplanation.description: A relative time, in seconds, based on the return value of the {@link module:MediaPlayer#duration duration()} method is expected
paramExplanation.name: time

paramExplanation.description:
A Callback function provided when retrieving thumbnail the given time position. Thumbnail object is null in case there are is not a thumbnails representation or
if it doesn't contain a thumbnail for the given time position.
paramExplanation.name: callback

name: getStreamsFromManifest
description: This method returns the list of all available streams from a given manifest

returns.description: list of {@link StreamInfo}

name: getTracksFor
description: This method returns the list of all available tracks for a given media type

returns.description: list of {@link MediaInfo}

name: getTracksForTypeFromManifest
description: This method returns the list of all available tracks for a given media type and streamInfo from a given manifest

returns.description: list of {@link MediaInfo}
{@link MediaInfo}

name: setInitialMediaSettingsFor
description:
This method allows to set media settings that will be used to pick the initial track. Format of the settings is following:
{lang: langValue (can be either a string or a regex to match), viewpoint: viewpointValue, audioChannelConfiguration: audioChannelConfigurationValue, accessibility: accessibilityValue, role: roleValue}

name: getInitialMediaSettingsFor
description:
This method returns media settings that is used to pick the initial track. Format of the settings
is following:
{lang: langValue,
 viewpoint: viewpointValue,
 audioChannelConfiguration: audioChannelConfigurationValue,
 accessibility: accessibilityValue,
 role: roleValue}

paramExplanation.description: instance of {@link MediaInfo}
paramExplanation.name: track

name: getTrackSwitchModeFor
description: This method returns the current track switch mode.

returns.description: mode

name: setTrackSwitchModeFor
description:
This method sets the current track switch mode. Available options are:

Constants.TRACK_SWITCH_MODE_NEVER_REPLACE
(used to forbid clearing the buffered data (prior to current playback position) after track switch.
Defers to fastSwitchEnabled for placement of new data. Default for video)

Constants.TRACK_SWITCH_MODE_ALWAYS_REPLACE
(used to clear the buffered data (prior to current playback position) after track switch. Default for audio)

name: setSelectionModeForInitialTrack
description:
This method sets the selection mode for the initial track. This mode defines how the initial track will be selected
if no initial media settings are set. If initial media settings are set this parameter will be ignored. Available options are:

Constants.TRACK_SELECTION_MODE_HIGHEST_BITRATE
this mode makes the player select the track with a highest bitrate. This mode is a default mode.

Constants.TRACK_SELECTION_MODE_WIDEST_RANGE
this mode makes the player select the track with a widest range of bitrates

name: getSelectionModeForInitialTrack
description: This method returns the track selection mode.

returns.description: mode

name: retrieveManifest
description:
Allows application to retrieve a manifest.  Manifest loading is asynchro
nous and
requires the app-provided callback function

paramExplanation.description: url the manifest url
paramExplanation.name: url

paramExplanation.description: A Callback function provided when retrieving manifests
paramExplanation.name: callback

name: addUTCTimingSource
description:
Allows you to set a scheme and server source for UTC live edge detection for dynamic streams. If UTCTiming is defined in the manifest, it will take precedence over any time source manually added.

If you have exposed the Date header, use the method {@link module:MediaPlayer#clearDefaultUTCTimingSources clearDefaultUTCTimingSources()}. This will allow the date header on the manifest to be used instead of a time server

paramExplanation.description:
• urn:mpeg:dash:utc:http-head:2014
  • urn:mpeg:dash:utc:http-xsdate:2014
  • urn:mpeg:dash:utc:http-iso:2014
  • urn:mpeg:dash:utc:direct:2014

Some specs referencing early ISO23009-1 drafts incorrectly use 2012 in the URI, rather than 2014. support these for now.

  • urn:mpeg:dash:utc:http-head:2012
  • urn:mpeg:dash:utc:http-xsdate:2012
  • urn:mpeg:dash:utc:http-iso:2012
  • urn:mpeg:dash:utc:direct:2012
paramExplanation.name: schemeIdUri

paramExplanation.description: Path to a time source.
paramExplanation.name: value

name: removeUTCTimingSource
description: Allows you to remove a UTC time source. Both schemeIdUri and value need to match the Dash.vo.UTCTiming properties in order for the entry to be removed from the array

paramExplanation.description: see {@link module:MediaPlayer#addUTCTimingSource addUTCTimingSource()}
paramExplanation.name: schemeIdUri

paramExplanation.description: see {@link module:MediaPlayer#addUTCTimingSource addUTCTimingSource()}
paramExplanation.name: value

name: clearDefaultUTCTimingSources
description:
Allows you to clear the stored array of time sources.

Example use: If you have exposed the Date header, calling this method will allow the date header on the manifest to be used instead of the time server.

Example use: Calling this method, assuming there is not an exposed date header on the manifest, will default back to using a binary search to discover the live edge

name: restoreDefaultUTCTimingSources
description: Allows you to restore the default time sources after calling {@link module:MediaPlayer#clearDefaultUTCTimingSources clearDefaultUTCTimingSources()}

name: setXHRWithCredentialsForType
description:
Sets whether withCredentials on XHR requests for a particular request
type is true or false

paramExplanation.description: one of HTTPRequest.*_TYPE
paramExplanation.name: type

name: getXHRWithCredentialsForType
description:
Gets whether withCredentials on XHR requests for a particular request
type is true or false

paramExplanation.description: one of HTTPRequest.*_TYPE
paramExplanation.name: type

name: getProtectionController
description: Detects if Protection is included and returns an instance of ProtectionController.js

name: attachProtectionController
description: Will override dash.js protection controller.

paramExplanation.description: valid protection controller instance.
paramExplanation.name: value

name: setProtectionData
description:
Sets Protection Data required to setup the Protection Module (DRM). Protection Data must
be set before initializing MediaPlayer or, once initialized, before PROTECTION_CREATED event is fired.

paramExplanation.description:
object containing
property names corresponding to key system name strings and associated
values being instances of.
paramExplanation.name: value

name: getOfflineController
description: Detects if Offline is included and returns an instance of OfflineController.js

name: displayCaptionsOnTop
description:
This method serves to control captions z-index value. If 'true' is passed, the captions will have the highest z-index and be
displayed on top of other html elements. Default value is 'false' (z-index is not set).

name: attachTTMLRenderingDiv
description: Use this method to attach an HTML5 div for dash.js to render rich TTML subtitles.

paramExplanation.description: An unstyled div placed after the video element. It will be styled to match the video size and overlay z-order.
paramExplanation.name: div

name: preload
reset
description:
Sets the MPD source and the video element to null. You can also reset the MediaPlayer by
calling attachSource with a new source file.

This call does not destroy the MediaPlayer. To destroy the MediaPlayer and free all of its
memory, call destroy().

name: addABRCustomRule
description:
Add a custom ABR Rule
Rule will be apply on next stream if a stream is being played

paramExplanation.description: rule type (one of ['qualitySwitchRules','abandonFragmentRules'])
paramExplanation.name: type

paramExplanation.description: name of rule (used to identify custom rule). If one rule of same name has been added, then existing rule will be updated
paramExplanation.name: rulename

paramExplanation.description: the rule object instance
paramExplanation.name: rule

name: removeABRCustomRule
description: Remove a custom ABR Rule

paramExplanation.description: name of the rule to be removed
paramExplanation.name: rulename

name: removeAllABRCustomRule
description: Remove all custom rules

returns.description: Current live stream latency in seconds. It is the difference between current time and time position at the playback head.

name: enableForcedTextStreaming
description:
Enable/disable text
When enabling dash will keep downloading and process fragmented text tracks even if all tracks are in mode "hidden"

paramExplanation.description: true to enable text streaming even if all text tracks are hidden.
paramExplanation.name: enable

name: isTextEnabled
description: Return if text is enabled

returns.description: return true if text is enabled, false otherwise

name: getAverageThroughput
description: Returns the average throughput computed in the ABR logic

returns.description: value

name: getSettings
description: Get the current settings object being used on the player.

returns.description: The settings object being used.

name: updateSettings
description:
This function does not update the entire object, only properties in the passed in object are updated.

This means that updateSettings({a: x}) and updateSettings({b: y}) are functionally equivalent to
updateSettings({a: x, b: y}). If the default values are required again, @see{@link resetSettings}.

paramExplanation.description: An object corresponding to the settings definition.
paramExplanation.name: settingsObj

name: resetSettings
description: Resets the settings object back to the default.
